revision.comment: Robot - Speedily moving category Mythological Greek characters to [[:Category:Characters in Greek mythology]] per [[WP:CFDS|CFDS]].
revision.text:
{{about|the female mythological character|the people|Dryopes}} In [[Greek mythology]], '''Dryope''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|d|r|aɪ|.|ə|p|iː}}; [[Ancient Greek]]: Δρυόπη derived from δρῦς ''drys'', "oak"; ''dryope'' "woodpecker"[[Robert Graves|Graves, Robert]], (1955) 1960. ''The Greek Myths''.) is the name attributed to several distinct figures: *[[Dryope (daughter of Dryops)|Dryope]], daughter of [[Dryops (Oeta)|Dryops]] and mother of [[Amphissus]] by [[Apollo]]. * Dryope, mother of Tarquitus by [[Faunus]], the god of the woods. Tarquitus was slain by [[Aeneas]].[[Virgil]], ''[[Aeneid]]'', 10. 551 * Dryope, a [[nymph]] responsible for kidnapping [[Hylas]], which she did in accord with [[Hera]]'s will.[[Gaius Valerius Flaccus]], Argonautica, 3. 529 ff; [[Statius]], ''Silvae'', 1. 5. 22; 3. 4. 42 Her name may have to do with the fact that Hylas was the son of [[Theiodamas]], the king of the [[Dryopes]]. * Dryope, a [[Ancient Thebes (Boeotia)|Theban]] woman of [[Phoenicia]]n origin, mother of [[Chromis (mythology)|Chromis]]. She joined the [[Maenads]] disregarding her pregnancy, and went into labor when she was dragging a sacrificial bull by the horns.[[Statius]], ''Thebaid'', 2. 614 ff * Dryope, a [[Lemnos|Lemnian]].[[Gaius Valerius Flaccus]], ''Argonautica'', 2. 174 ==See also== * [[Dryopia]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==Sources== * [[Robert Graves|Graves, Robert]], (1955) 1960. ''The Greek Myths''. 21.j; 26.5; 56.2; 150.b, 1. * {{cite book| last = Grimal| first = Pierre| title = Dictionnaire de la Mythologie Grecque Et Romaine| url = https://books.google.com/books?id=MjU12GGtMZoC&pg=PA142| year = 1996| publisher = Wiley| isbn = 978-0-631-20102-1| page = 142 }} * [[Karl Kerenyi|Kerenyi]], Karl. 1951. ''The Gods of the Greeks'' 141, 173. * {{cite book| author = Mark Percy Owen Morford| title = Classical mythology| url = https://books.google.com/books?id=ecGXcMRAPXcC&pg=PA228| year = 1999| publisher = Oxford University Press| isbn = 978-0-19-514338-6| page = 228 }} * [[William Smith (lexicographer)|Smith, William]]; ''[[Dictionary of Greek and Roman Biography and Mythology]]'', London (1873). [http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=Perseus%3Atext%3A1999.04.0104%3Aalphabetic+letter%3DD%3Aentry+group%3D18%3Aentry%3Ddryope-bio-1 "Dry'ope"] * ''[[Realencyclopädie der Classischen Altertumswissenschaft]]'', Band V, Halbband 10, Donatio-Ephoroi (1905), s. 1746
